liber_application.controller

Class BookLoanController

  • java.lang.Object
    • liber_application.controller.BookLoanController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/loans")
public class BookLoanController
extends java.lang.Object
    A REST controller for the book loans.
    Author:
    Valter Ekholm

      • getBookLoansCollection

        @GetMapping
public BookLoanCollection getBookLoansCollection()
        Get all loans Called with GET /books Method aimed for XML (or Json) format
        Returns:
        - a BookCollection that wraps all books

      • getBookLoanById

        @GetMapping(path="/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BookLoan> getBookLoanById(@PathVariable
                                                                                                    java.lang.Integer id)
        Get loan by id Call with GET loans/1
        Parameters:
        id - id of loan
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity and if loan is found: the loan and HttpStatus.FOUND, else just HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND

      • getBookLoanByEmail

        @GetMapping(path="/email/{email}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BookLoanCollection> getBookLoanByEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Get all loans connected to a specific email address Call with GET loans/email/john@supermail.se
        Parameters:
        email - - the email that can be stored in User of a BookLoan
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity and if any found: a BookLoanCollection with loans, else just HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND

      • isLoanOverdue

        @GetMapping(path="/isOverdue/{loanId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Boolean> isLoanOverdue(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                         java.lang.Integer loanId)
        Check if a loan is overdue (it's return date has passed) Call with GET /loans/isOverdue/1
        Parameters:
        loanId - - the id of a loan
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity and if found true/false else just HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND

      • getLoanStatus

        @GetMapping(path="/status/{loanId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> getLoanStatus(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                     java.lang.Integer loanId)
        Get the "status" of a loan, defined in the JavaDoc of class BookLoan
        Parameters:
        loanId - - the id of a loan
        Returns:
        string telling the status of a loan

      • saveLoan

        @PostMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BookLoan> saveLoan(@RequestBody
                                                                                BookLoanRepresentation bookLoan)
        Save a loan Called with POST to /loans - Json {"readerId":2,"bookId":1} or {"readerId":2,"bookId":1,"startingDate":"2010-01-01"} Or with POST to /loans {"readerEmail":"valterekholm1@gmail.com","bookId":1} or {"readerEmail":"valterekholm1@gmail.com","bookId":1,"startingDate":"2010-01-01"} Or with a forth argument of "allowedWeeksLength":1
        Parameters:
        bookLoan - - serialized data of a book loan (readerId, readerEmail, bookId, startingDate, allowedWeeksLength)
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with saved BookLoan or (if error) id of any book/user not found

      • updateLoan

        @PutMapping(path="/{loanId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BookLoan> updateLoan(@PathVariable
                                                                                                   java.lang.Integer loanId,
                                                                                                   @RequestBody
                                                                                                   BookLoanRepresentation loan)
        Update a loan - overwriting all fields except id Called with PUT /loans/1 and Json Body {"readerId": 1, "bookId":1, "startingDate":"2011-11-11", "allowedWeeksLength":1}, see saveLoan()
        Parameters:
        loanId - - the id of a loan
        loan - - serialized data of a book loan
        Returns:
        The updated BookLoan

      • endNow

        @PutMapping(path="/back/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BookLoan> endNow(@PathVariable
                                                                                                java.lang.Integer id)
        Register a returning of a book, setting the returnedDate to present date and time Called with PUT /back/1
        Parameters:
        id - - the id of a loan
        Returns:
        the updated BookLoan

      • deleteLoan

        @DeleteMapping(path="/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BookLoan> deleteLoan(@PathVariable
                                                                                                  java.lang.Integer loanId)
        Called with DELETE /loans/1
        Parameters:
        loanId - - the id of a loan
        Returns:
        a ResponseEntity and if id not found HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND, else HttpStatus.OK
